data.title: Are salaries ready for 'scary' expenses? IITian breaks down real cost of living in big Indian cities
data.description: IIT graduate and Rainbow Money founder Siddharth Mukund has raised concerns about the growing gap between salaries and expenses in Indias metropolitan cities. In a LinkedIn post, he pointed out that pre-pandemic salary hikes gave professionals the confidence to take on EMIs, but today job stability has weakened and pay raises are often below 5%. With many employees now spending nearly half their income on loans and insurance, household budgets are under severe strain. Rising school fees, healthcare costs, and living expenses have pushed job switches to become survival-driven rather than ambition-led.
data.keywords: salary vs expenses india, cost of living in indian cities, job stability in india, emi burden on middle class, iitian founder, corporate salary hikes, middle class challenges, rising cost of living, financial pressure, financial stability India
data.snippet:
From Predictability to Instability

Mounting Burden of Loans and Insurance

MORE STORIES FOR YOU ✕ « Back to recommendation stories I don't want to see these...
data.title_en: Are salaries ready for 'scary' expenses? IITian breaks down real cost of living in big Indian cities
